column2: Role Description Market and Valuation Risk Management (MVRM) provides an independent view of market risks and valuation to Deutsche Banks senior management. Market risk team manages Deutsche Banks Market Risk position in an independent and neutral way. You will be a part of the Market Risk Analysis and Control (MRAC) function within MVRM and will be responsible for the provision of all official market risk metrics and core analysis in support of risk management decision making for Global Foreign Exchange asset class. The team operates a business/asset class and risk metric aligned organizational matrix supported by central functions. The team has a global presence with staff located in London, New York, Berlin, Singapore, Mumbai and Bengaluru. You will be exposed to risk management techniques viz. analysis/computation of VaR, SVaR, Economic Capital, IRC, Backtesting, FRTB for a diverse range of derivative products. The team is also proficient in combining this risk knowledge with best in class automation and visualization skills including python/VBA/Tableau to provide value added analytical outputs to its stakeholders You will be expected to be proficient in automation tools (python essentially) with sufficient knowledge of risk to enhance the output of the team. Your key responsibilities  The role is of the Lead for Credit Asset Class team covering primarily below responsibilities: Manage the Credit Team (Commercial Real Estate) and associated Book of Work Daily risk validation by working closely with risk production team based out of Pune Review and understand the historical simulation VaR, SVaR and other metrics such as Economic Capital (EC), FRTB and Backtesting (outlier analysis), including staying abreast of the development of this metric and related drivers Facilitating better risk analysis and automated reporting infrastructure to stakeholders using required programming tools (python/Tableau etc.)  is a critical part of profile Perform deep dive analysis into concentrations of risk or emerging items of interest, providing high quality and accurate information at a level for senior management consumption Perform analytical analysis of our limit to generate proposals for limit changes and for new limits Support the analysis and communication of business portfolio level topics to senior management and their committees Work on automation projects that help improve efficiency and controls. Your skills and experience University degree in Finance, Economics, Mathematics or other quantitative subjects. 7+ years experience in Market Risk within the Financial Market Investment Banking industry (other relevant backgrounds e.g. Trading, Product Control, IPV will also be considered) Working knowledge of Python/VBA, Tableau will be added advantage Good understanding of other Market Risk measurement techniques e.g. VaR, RNiV, Economic Capital, IRC. Excellent stakeholder management skills and communication skills; ability to articulate technical and financial topics with global stakeholders A reliable team player with the motivation to work in a dynamic, international and diverse environment Able to multi-task and deliver under tight deadlines A committed and motivated individual for self-development and growth
column10: Investment Banking / Venture Capital / Private Equity
column11: Market Risk, Product Control, Investment Banking, VBA, Trading, Market Risk Analysis, Tableau, IPV, Python

column2: Our Purpose: At PwC, our purpose is to build trust in society and solve important problems. A. About PwC: Were a network of firms in 158 countries with over 250,000 people who are committed to delivering quality in assurance, advisory and tax services. In India, PwC has offices in Ahmedabad, Bengaluru, Bhopal, Chennai, Dehradun, Delhi NCR, Hyderabad, Kolkata, Mumbai, Pune, Raipur and Shimla. Find out more at www.pwc.com. B. About the team: FSTRM - We are a team that includes subject matter experts with deep industry experience and from varied backgrounds including world bank, insurance, regulator, risk management, treasury, banking, information technology and consulting. This enables us to address a variety of client issues. The teams skill sets, and competencies span multiple fields that demand an in-depth knowledge of quantitative methods across risk analytics, predictive and decision modelling, advanced analytics like ML/AI, actuary, capital estimations, pricing of financial instruments including derivatives and regulatory remediation. The actuarial projects focus on wide array of requirements varying from due diligence, product development, actuarial audit, actuarial modelling and with current focus on IFRS 17. C. Job Title: Senior Associate / Associate Actuarial D. Function: FSTRM, Actuarial E. Location: Mumbai/Gurgaon REQUIREMENTS I. QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE 1. Minimum Bachelors degree or equivalent in Mathematics, Actuarial Science or related field 2. Minimum 5 actuarial Exam - with minimum 3 years of experience in Insurance or Consulting Firms II. EXPERTISE 1. Thorough understanding of life insurance products, Indian statutory requirements and experience in Product Pricing, Modelling, Reserving or Financial Reporting. 2. IFRS 17 and Solvency II understanding is an added advantage 3. Prophet skills add significant advantage. Other actuarial software including SQL, Python, GGY-Axis is an added advantage 4. The candidate should have prior experience of working in the India domestic market through insurance or consulting. III. INDIVIDUAL ATTRIBUTES 1. Strong communication skills 2. Ability to be part of an analytics driven, multi-cultural team and work independently as well 3. Good attitude and be a part of team player 4. Ability to interact and make presentations

column2: We are seeking an experienced Techno-Functional SME with a deep understanding of digital banking. The ideal candidate should have a proven track record in setting up ground-up digital banks, familiarity with underlying banking products, and the ability to collaborate effectively with fintech partners. As a Techno-Functional SME, you will play a critical role in shaping our digital banking initiatives.                         ?             Responsibilities:                     Digital Bank Setup   :                   Lead the establishment of digital banks from scratch, including defining the technology stack, architecture, and operational processes.                 Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration of digital banking services.                     Digital Banking Value Chain   :                   Possess a holistic understanding of the digital banking value chain, including customer onboarding, account management, payments, lending, and customer experience.                 Identify opportunities for process optimization and efficiency enhancements across the value chain.                     Product Knowledge   :                   Be well-versed in underlying digital banking products, such as internet banking, mobile banking, cards, UPI, IMPS, POS, IPG, and digital lending applications.                 Understand the end-to-end lifecycle of these products and their impact on customer experience.                     Fintech Collaboration   :                   Collaborate with fintech partners to enhance digital banking offerings.                 Evaluate and onboard relevant fintech solutions to augment our digital services.                 Stay updated on emerging fintech trends and technologies.                     Technical Expertise   :                   Provide technical insights to development teams during the implementation of digital banking solutions.                 Ensure alignment with industry best practices and regulatory requirements.                     Stakeholder Management   :                   Engage with internal stakeholders (business, IT, compliance, risk) to drive digital transformation initiatives.                 Communicate effectively with external partners and vendors.                     Qualifications:                       Education   : bachelors or masters Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or related fields.                   Certifications (Desired)   : Relevant certifications in project management, agile methodologies, or digital banking.                     Desired Skills:                     Technical Skills   :                   Proficiency in digital banking platforms, APIs, and microservices architecture.                 Familiarity with cloud-based solutions and security protocols.                 Knowledge of data analytics and business intelligence tools.                     Domain Expertise   :                   Experience in setting up digital banks or transforming traditional banks into digital-first institutions.                 Understanding of regulatory compliance and risk management in digital banking.                     Collaboration Skills   :                   Ability to work closely with fintech partners, negotiate contracts, and build strong relationships.                 Excellent communication skills to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.

column2: AXA XL is looking for talented individuals to support our business across all product lines and geographies. This is an exciting opportunity to be part of a dynamic, global business. Analysts - Policy Management work with Underwriters operating in our international hubs such as New York, Singapore, and London, and supports processing tasks such as Bound, Endorsements, Policy Issuance, etc . What will your essential responsibilities include? Directly support AXA XL underwriters / DAMs in Policy Administration. Support issuance of policy documents for the insured. In case of policy non-renewals, send out the conditional / non-renewal policy documents. Issue endorsements in case of any mid-term changes during the policy period. Generate policy numbers for the insured. Renew or decline policies as per the instructions from the underwriters. Were looking for someone who has these abilities and skills: University graduate with couple of years of ground work experience. Ability to follow defined processes and procedures. Organized, methodical, and ability to perform multiple tasks. Compelling customer-service focus. Ability to prioritize workload. Persuasive communication skills, both verbal and written; fluent in English. Ability to communicate results and technical issues in a professional manner. Influential collaborative skills: the ability to work effectively in a team environment.
column11: Policy Management, Policy Administration, customer service, Policy Issuance

column2: We are looking for a qualified candidate to join our team as a US Insurance professional        In this role, you will be responsible for managing and processing insurance claims, policy administration, and client services      Your knowledge of US insurance regulations, policies, and procedures will be crucial in ensuring compliance and providing excellent customer service      Strong communication skills and attention to detail are required to effectively communicate with clients, agents, and underwriters      Additionally, you will handle policy renewals, endorsements, and policyholder inquiries with accuracy and efficiency               Job Requirement:            Strong knowledge of US insurance regulations, policies, and procedures. Excellent communication skills to interact with clients, agents, and underwriters.              Attention to detail and accuracy in handling insurance documentation and transactions.              Familiarity with insurance software and systems.              Ability to analyze and assess risks and coverage options.              Knowledge of different types of insurance, such as property, casualty, health, or life insurance.              Strong customer service skills to provide exceptional service to policyholders.              Adaptability and ability to work in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment.
